verses.text: 智慧人懂得判斷時機誰像智慧人，誰知道事情的解釋呢？人的智慧使他容光煥發，使他臉上的戾氣轉消。

words.note: Refers to a person possessing wisdom, common in Ecclesiastes.

words.definition: to understand, to know how to

words.note: Refers to a person possessing wisdom, common in Ecclesiastes.
A four-character idiom describing a radiant appearance.
Refers to a malevolent or hostile atmosphere/temperament.

verses.text: 我勸你，因為你指著 神起了誓，你就要遵守王的命令。

words.note: Traditional Chinese reverential space before sacred names.
Refers to the unique God in monotheistic contexts, often capitalized.
V-O compound, meaning 'to make/take an oath'.

verses.text: 不要輕率離開王的面前，也不要參與惡事，因為王可以隨己意作任何事。

words.definition: to participate in, to be involved in

words.note: Often used in a moral or religious context for 'evil things'.

words.definition: as one pleases, according to one's will
words.note: A fixed expression meaning 'following one's own desires'.

verses.text: 既然王的話有權柄，誰敢問他：「你在作甚麼？」

words.note: Often used in religious or formal contexts for supreme authority.
Indicates an action is ongoing or in progress.
Also written as 什麼.

verses.text: 遵守命令的，必不遭受災禍；智慧人的心，曉得時機，懂得判斷。

words.note: Turns the preceding phrase into a noun, 'those who...'
Often refers to divine judgment or severe misfortune.
Refers to a person possessing wisdom, common in Ecclesiastes.
A somewhat formal or classical synonym for 知道 (zhīdào).

words.definition: to understand, to know how to

verses.text: 各樣事務成就，都有合宜的時機和定局，儘管人的災禍重壓在自己身上。
他不曉得未來的事，將來要發生甚麼，誰能告訴他呢？
沒有人能支配風（「風」或譯：「生命」），把它留住；沒有人能控制死期；戰爭之時，沒有人能免役；邪惡救不了行邪惡的人。

words.note: Can also refer to 'spirit' or 'breath' in religious contexts.
A classical literary particle.

words.definition: to escape military service, be exempt

words.note: Indicates the impossibility of the verb's action.
Forms a noun phrase from a preceding adjective or verb.

verses.text: 敬畏 神終得福樂我看見了這一切，又專心查究在日光之下所發生的一切事。有這樣的一個時候：有人管轄別人，叫他受害。

words.note: Refers to the singular divine entity.
'Under the sun' is a key phrase in Ecclesiastes, meaning 'on earth'.
Forms a noun phrase from the following verb.

words.definition: to suffer harm, to be harmed

verses.text: 然後我看見惡人得以埋葬，他們生前在聖地往來，而在他們這樣行的城中，竟被人遺忘。這也是虛空！（全節或譯：「然後我看見惡人得以埋葬，他們生前在聖地往來，並且在他們這樣行的城中，受人稱讚。這也是虛空！」或「然後我看見惡人得以埋葬，歸入墳墓；行正直的人卻與聖地隔離，在城中被人遺忘。這也是虛空！」）

words.definition: to be able to, to succeed in
to come and go, to frequent

words.note: A key theme in Ecclesiastes, often translated as 'meaningless' or 'futile'.

verses.text: 對惡行已判定的刑罰遲遲沒有執行，世人的心就充滿行惡的意圖。

words.definition: to do evil, to commit evil

verses.text: 罪人既然作惡百次，還享長壽，那麼我知道敬畏 神的人，就是在他面前存敬畏的心的，必享福樂。

words.definition: to do evil, to commit evil

words.note: Refers to the Creator God.
Here, it refers to 'the one who...'

verses.text: 惡人卻沒有福樂，也得不到長壽；他好像影子的短暫，因為他在 神面前不存敬畏的心。

words.note: Refers to the Creator God.

verses.text: 在世上有一件虛空的事，就是義人照惡人所行的受報應，惡人照義人所行的得報償。我說，這也是虛空。

words.note: A key theme in Ecclesiastes, often translated as 'vanity'.

words.definition: marker of a passive or nominalized verb
marker of a passive or nominalized verb

words.note: A key theme in Ecclesiastes, often translated as 'vanity'.

verses.text: 於是我稱頌快樂，因為人在日光之下最好是吃喝快樂。這是人在日光之下， 神賜給他一生的年日裡，從自己勞碌中所得的享受。

words.note: Common biblical phrase, esp. in Ecclesiastes, referring to earthly life.
Common biblical phrase, esp. in Ecclesiastes, referring to earthly life.
Refers to the Creator God.
Refers to the span of one's life.

words.definition: marker of a passive or nominalized verb

verses.text: 我專心認識智慧，察看世上的勞碌──有人晝夜不眠──

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts for divine wisdom.
Expresses hardship and effort; common in Ecclesiastes.

verses.text: 於是我看見了 神的一切作為，知道在日光之下所發生的事，人不能查明；儘管人勞碌尋查，總是查不出來；即使智慧人以為知道了，還是查不出來。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
The phrase 'under the sun' is a theme in Ecclesiastes.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which'.
Expresses hard effort; here, modifying 'search'.
A verb-complement construction indicating inability to ascertain.
Often found in biblical wisdom literature, e.g., Ecclesiastes.
A verb-complement construction indicating inability to ascertain.
